content: Is there a way to indicate if a user is an internal LDAP user, or an external (meaning invited) user? Perhaps with a small overlay in the display jpg, or some specific username colour in the userlist, or perhaps make the username italic..? It would be nice to be able to see "where a user comes from"... (internal vs external)
@mouk I am pretty sure we don't have anything like that yet.
@mouk can you talk more about the use case? Is the idea that you're inviting contractors who aren't in LDAP and want to distinguish them?

Yes, it's exactly that. We have of course many 'internal' AD users. They can invite external users into the system. (which is VERY nice and one of the reasons we actually chose zulip) However, these external users become indistinguishable from 'internal company users' once they are in the system.
The only difference is an external email address, which is something you don't immediately see, unless you open their detailed profile.
Yeah, makes sense. Have you considered inviting them as guest users? I believe they are visually distinguished in how their avatars are displayed.
No, i tried it just now, but they look exactly the same, at least in the users list on the right.
